tourism_samples.title: Galle Fort
tourism_samples.description: Galle Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is a historic coastal fortress with cobblestone streets, colonial buildings, museums, and cultural events.

tourism_samples.title: Unawatuna Beach
tourism_samples.description: Unawatuna is a famous beach near Galle with calm turquoise waters, snorkeling spots, and beachside cafes.

tourism_samples.title: Hikkaduwa Beach
tourism_samples.description: Hikkaduwa is a lively beach town known for surfing, coral reefs, nightlife, and seafood restaurants.

tourism_samples.title: Mirissa Beach
tourism_samples.description: Mirissa is a southern coastal town with golden beaches, turquoise waters, whale watching, surfing, and local seafood restaurants.

tourism_samples.title: Bentota Beach
tourism_samples.description: Bentota is a popular beach resort town with water sports, mangrove boat rides, and luxury hotels.

tourism_samples.title: Sigiriya Rock Fortress
tourism_samples.description: Sigiriya, known as Lion Rock, is an ancient fortress with frescoes, water gardens, and terraced landscapes. Visitors can climb to the summit for panoramic views.

tourism_samples.title: Dambulla Cave Temple
tourism_samples.description: Dambulla is a UNESCO-listed cave temple complex with ancient Buddha statues and murals carved into rock.

tourism_samples.title: Anuradhapura Sacred City
tourism_samples.description: Anuradhapura is an ancient city with massive stupas, monasteries, and sacred Buddhist heritage sites.

tourism_samples.title: Temple of the Tooth Relic
tourism_samples.description: Located in Kandy, this sacred temple houses the tooth relic of Buddha and hosts daily religious rituals.

tourism_samples.title: Kandy Lake
tourism_samples.description: Kandy Lake is a scenic man-made lake in the heart of Kandy, perfect for evening walks and views of the Temple of the Tooth.

tourism_samples.title: Ella
tourism_samples.description: Ella is a tranquil hill town with lush tea plantations, waterfalls, and scenic hiking trails like Ella Rock and Little Adam’s Peak.

tourism_samples.title: Nine Arches Bridge
tourism_samples.description: The Nine Arches Bridge in Ella is a famous colonial-era railway bridge surrounded by jungle and tea fields.

tourism_samples.title: Horton Plains National Park
tourism_samples.description: Horton Plains is a highland plateau with cloud forests, grasslands, waterfalls, and the dramatic World’s End cliff.

tourism_samples.title: Nuwara Eliya
tourism_samples.description: Nuwara Eliya, known as Little England, is a cool hill town with tea plantations, lakes, waterfalls, and colonial architecture.

tourism_samples.title: Yala National Park
tourism_samples.description: Yala National Park is a wildlife sanctuary famous for leopards, elephants, and safari jeep tours.

tourism_samples.title: Udawalawe National Park
tourism_samples.description: Udawalawe is a popular wildlife park known for elephant sightings and wide open grasslands.

tourism_samples.title: Trincomalee
tourism_samples.description: Trincomalee is a coastal city with pristine beaches, Koneswaram Temple, diving spots, and historic forts.

tourism_samples.title: Nilaveli Beach
tourism_samples.description: Nilaveli is a beautiful white-sand beach near Trincomalee, ideal for snorkeling and relaxation.

tourism_samples.title: Arugam Bay
tourism_samples.description: Arugam Bay is a world-renowned surfing destination on the east coast, known for its laid-back vibe, point breaks, and vibrant nightlife.

tourism_samples.title: Polonnaruwa Ancient City
tourism_samples.description: The second ancient capital of Sri Lanka, featuring well-preserved ruins of royal palaces, temples, and the magnificent Gal Vihara rock sculptures.

tourism_samples.title: Jaffna Fort
tourism_samples.description: A historic fortress in the northern tip of Sri Lanka, reflecting both Portuguese and Dutch architectural influences and offering views of the Jaffna lagoon.
